table.name: auth_usr
table.viewSql: SELECT auth_user.id, auth_user.last_login, auth_user.is_superuser, auth_user.username, auth_user.first_name, auth_user.last_name, CASE WHEN ((auth_user.email)::text = ''::text) THEN ''::text ELSE (((auth_user.id)::character varying)::text || "substring"((auth_user.email)::text, "position"((auth_user.email)::text, '@'::text))) END AS email, auth_user.is_staff, auth_user.is_active, auth_user.date_joined FROM auth_user;

table.name: geography_columns
table.viewSql: SELECT current_database() AS f_table_catalog, n.nspname AS f_table_schema, c.relname AS f_table_name, a.attname AS f_geography_column, postgis_typmod_dims(a.atttypmod) AS coord_dimension, postgis_typmod_srid(a.atttypmod) AS srid, postgis_typmod_type(a.atttypmod) AS type FROM pg_class c, pg_attribute a, pg_type t, pg_namespace n WHERE ((t.typname = 'geography'::name) AND (a.attisdropped = false) AND (a.atttypid = t.oid) AND (a.attrelid = c.oid) AND (c.relnamespace = n.oid) AND (c.relkind = ANY (ARRAY['r'::"char", 'v'::"char", 'm'::"char", 'f'::"char", 'p'::"char"])) AND (NOT pg_is_other_temp_schema(c.relnamespace)) AND has_table_privilege(c.oid, 'SELECT'::text));

table.name: geometry_columns
table.viewSql: SELECT (current_database())::character varying(256) AS f_table_catalog, n.nspname AS f_table_schema, c.relname AS f_table_name, a.attname AS f_geometry_column, COALESCE(postgis_typmod_dims(a.atttypmod), sn.ndims, 2) AS coord_dimension, COALESCE(NULLIF(postgis_typmod_srid(a.atttypmod), 0), sr.srid, 0) AS srid, (replace(replace(COALESCE(NULLIF(upper(postgis_typmod_type(a.atttypmod)), 'GEOMETRY'::text), st.type, 'GEOMETRY'::text), 'ZM'::text, ''::text), 'Z'::text, ''::text))::character varying(30) AS type FROM ((((((pg_class c JOIN pg_attribute a ON (((a.attrelid = c.oid) AND (NOT a.attisdropped)))) JOIN pg_namespace n ON ((c.relnamespace = n.oid))) JOIN pg_type t ON ((a.atttypid = t.oid))) LEFT JOIN ( SELECT s.connamespace, s.conrelid, s.conkey, replace(split_part(s.consrc, ''''::text, 2), ')'::text, ''::text) AS type FROM ( SELECT pg_constraint.connamespace, pg_constraint.conrelid, pg_constraint.conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(pg_constraint.oid) AS consrc FROM pg_constraint) s WHERE (s.consrc ~~* '%geometrytype(% = %'::text)) st ON (((st.connamespace = n.oid) AND (st.conrelid = c.oid) AND (a.attnum = ANY (st.conkey))))) LEFT JOIN ( SELECT s.connamespace, s.conrelid, s.conkey, (replace(split_part(s.consrc, ' = '::text, 2), ')'::text, ''::text))::integer AS ndims FROM ( SELECT pg_constraint.connamespace, pg_constraint.conrelid, pg_constraint.conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(pg_constraint.oid) AS consrc FROM pg_constraint) s WHERE (s.consrc ~~* '%ndims(% = %'::text)) sn ON (((sn.connamespace = n.oid) AND (sn.conrelid = c.oid) AND (a.attnum = ANY (sn.conkey))))) LEFT JOIN ( SELECT s.connamespace, s.conrelid, s.conkey, (replace(replace(split_part(s.consrc, ' = '::text, 2), ')'::text, ''::text), '('::text, ''::text))::integer AS srid FROM ( SELECT pg_constraint.connamespace, pg_constraint.conrelid, pg_constraint.conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(pg_constraint.oid) AS consrc FROM pg_constraint) s WHERE (s.consrc ~~* '%srid(% = %'::text)) sr ON (((sr.connamespace = n.oid) AND (sr.conrelid = c.oid) AND (a.attnum = ANY (sr.conkey))))) WHERE ((c.relkind = ANY (ARRAY['r'::"char", 'v'::"char", 'm'::"char", 'f'::"char", 'p'::"char"])) AND (NOT (c.relname = 'raster_columns'::name)) AND (t.typname = 'geometry'::name) AND (NOT pg_is_other_temp_schema(c.relnamespace)) AND has_table_privilege(c.oid, 'SELECT'::text));

routine.name: _postgis_deprecate
_postgis_pgsql_version
addauth
routine.comment: args: auth_token - Adds an authorization token to be used in the current transaction.

routine.name: addgeometrycolumn
routine.comment: args: catalog_name, schema_name, table_name, column_name, srid, type, dimension, use_typmod=true - Adds a geometry column to an existing table.

routine.name: checkauth
routine.comment: args: a_table_name, a_key_column_name - Creates a trigger on a table to prevent/allow updates and deletes of rows based on authorization token.

routine.name: disablelongtransactions
routine.comment: Disables long transaction support.

routine.name: dropgeometrycolumn
routine.comment: args: catalog_name, schema_name, table_name, column_name - Removes a geometry column from a spatial table.

routine.name: dropgeometrytable
routine.comment: args: catalog_name, schema_name, table_name - Drops a table and all its references in geometry_columns.

routine.name: enablelongtransactions
routine.comment: Enables long transaction support.

routine.name: find_srid
routine.comment: args: a_schema_name, a_table_name, a_geomfield_name - Returns the SRID defined for a geometry column.

routine.name: get_proj4_from_srid
longtransactionsenabled
populate_geometry_columns
routine.comment: args: relation_oid, use_typmod=true - Ensures geometry columns are defined with type modifiers or have appropriate spatial constraints.

routine.name: postgis_addbbox
routine.comment: args: geomA - Add bounding box to the geometry.

routine.name: postgis_constraint_dims
routine.definition: SELECT replace(split_part(s.consrc, ' = ', 2), ')', '')::integer FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%ndims(% = %';

routine.name: postgis_constraint_srid
routine.definition: SELECT replace(replace(split_part(s.consrc, ' = ', 2), ')', ''), '(', '')::integer FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%srid(% = %';

routine.name: postgis_constraint_type
routine.definition: SELECT replace(split_part(s.consrc, '''', 2), ')', '')::varchar FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%geometrytype(% = %';

routine.name: postgis_dropbbox
routine.comment: args: geomA - Drop the bounding box cache from the geometry.

routine.name: postgis_extensions_upgrade
routine.comment: args: target_version=null - Packages and upgrades PostGIS extensions (e.g. postgis_raster,postgis_topology, postgis_sfcgal) to given or latest version.

routine.name: postgis_full_version
routine.comment: Reports full PostGIS version and build configuration infos.

routine.name: postgis_geos_compiled_version
routine.comment: Returns the version number of the GEOS library against which PostGIS was built.

routine.name: postgis_geos_version
routine.comment: Returns the version number of the GEOS library.

routine.name: postgis_hasbbox
routine.comment: args: geomA - Returns TRUE if the bbox of this geometry is cached, FALSE otherwise.

routine.name: postgis_lib_build_date
routine.comment: Returns build date of the PostGIS library.

routine.name: postgis_lib_version
routine.comment: Returns the version number of the PostGIS library.

routine.name: postgis_liblwgeom_version
routine.comment: Returns the version number of the liblwgeom library. This should match the version of PostGIS.

routine.name: postgis_libxml_version
routine.comment: Returns the version number of the libxml2 library.

routine.name: postgis_proj_version
routine.comment: Returns the version number of the PROJ4 library.

routine.name: postgis_scripts_build_date
routine.comment: Returns build date of the PostGIS scripts.

routine.name: postgis_scripts_installed
routine.comment: Returns version of the PostGIS scripts installed in this database.

routine.name: postgis_scripts_released
routine.comment: Returns the version number of the postgis.sql script released with the installed PostGIS lib.

routine.name: postgis_sfcgal_full_version
routine.comment: Returns the full version of SFCGAL in use including CGAL and Boost versions

routine.name: postgis_sfcgal_version
routine.comment: Returns the version of SFCGAL in use

routine.name: postgis_srs
routine.comment: args: auth_name, auth_srid - Return a metadata record for the requested authority and srid.

routine.name: postgis_srs_all
routine.comment: Return metadata records for every spatial reference system in the underlying Proj database.

routine.name: postgis_srs_codes
routine.comment: args: auth_name - Return the list of SRS codes associated with the given authority.

routine.name: postgis_srs_search
routine.comment: args: bounds, auth_name=EPSG - Return metadata records for projected coordinate systems that have areas of useage that fully contain the bounds parameter.

routine.name: postgis_type_name
routine.definition:
SELECT CASE WHEN $3 THEN new_name ELSE old_name END As geomname FROM ( VALUES ('GEOMETRY', 'Geometry', 2), ('GEOMETRY', 'GeometryZ', 3), ('GEOMETRYM', 'GeometryM', 3), ('GEOMETRY', 'GeometryZM', 4),
('GEOMETRYCOLLECTION', 'GeometryCollection', 2), ('GEOMETRYCOLLECTION', 'GeometryCollectionZ', 3), ('GEOMETRYCOLLECTIONM', 'GeometryCollectionM', 3), ('GEOMETRYCOLLECTION', 'GeometryCollectionZM', 4),
('POINT', 'Point', 2), ('POINT', 'PointZ', 3), ('POINTM','PointM', 3), ('POINT', 'PointZM', 4),
('MULTIPOINT','MultiPoint', 2), ('MULTIPOINT','MultiPointZ', 3), ('MULTIPOINTM','MultiPointM', 3), ('MULTIPOINT','MultiPointZM', 4),
('POLYGON', 'Polygon', 2), ('POLYGON', 'PolygonZ', 3), ('POLYGONM', 'PolygonM', 3), ('POLYGON', 'PolygonZM', 4),
('MULTIPOLYGON', 'MultiPolygon', 2), ('MULTIPOLYGON', 'MultiPolygonZ', 3), ('MULTIPOLYGONM', 'MultiPolygonM', 3), ('MULTIPOLYGON', 'MultiPolygonZM', 4),
('MULTILINESTRING', 'MultiLineString', 2), ('MULTILINESTRING', 'MultiLineStringZ', 3), ('MULTILINESTRINGM', 'MultiLineStringM', 3), ('MULTILINESTRING', 'MultiLineStringZM', 4),
('LINESTRING', 'LineString', 2), ('LINESTRING', 'LineStringZ', 3), ('LINESTRINGM', 'LineStringM', 3), ('LINESTRING', 'LineStringZM', 4),
('CIRCULARSTRING', 'CircularString', 2), ('CIRCULARSTRING', 'CircularStringZ', 3), ('CIRCULARSTRINGM', 'CircularStringM' ,3), ('CIRCULARSTRING', 'CircularStringZM', 4),
('COMPOUNDCURVE', 'CompoundCurve', 2), ('COMPOUNDCURVE', 'CompoundCurveZ', 3), ('COMPOUNDCURVEM', 'CompoundCurveM', 3), ('COMPOUNDCURVE', 'CompoundCurveZM', 4),
('CURVEPOLYGON', 'CurvePolygon', 2), ('CURVEPOLYGON', 'CurvePolygonZ', 3), ('CURVEPOLYGONM', 'CurvePolygonM', 3), ('CURVEPOLYGON', 'CurvePolygonZM', 4),
('MULTICURVE', 'MultiCurve', 2), ('MULTICURVE', 'MultiCurveZ', 3), ('MULTICURVEM', 'MultiCurveM', 3), ('MULTICURVE', 'MultiCurveZM', 4),
('MULTISURFACE', 'MultiSurface', 2), ('MULTISURFACE', 'MultiSurfaceZ', 3), ('MULTISURFACEM', 'MultiSurfaceM', 3), ('MULTISURFACE', 'MultiSurfaceZM', 4),
('POLYHEDRALSURFACE', 'PolyhedralSurface', 2), ('POLYHEDRALSURFACE', 'PolyhedralSurfaceZ', 3), ('POLYHEDRALSURFACEM', 'PolyhedralSurfaceM', 3), ('POLYHEDRALSURFACE', 'PolyhedralSurfaceZM', 4),
('TRIANGLE', 'Triangle', 2), ('TRIANGLE', 'TriangleZ', 3), ('TRIANGLEM', 'TriangleM', 3), ('TRIANGLE', 'TriangleZM', 4),
('TIN', 'Tin', 2), ('TIN', 'TinZ', 3), ('TINM', 'TinM', 3), ('TIN', 'TinZM', 4) ) As g(old_name, new_name, coord_dimension) WHERE (upper(old_name) = upper($1) OR upper(new_name) = upper($1)) AND coord_dimension = $2;

routine.name: postgis_version
routine.comment: Returns PostGIS version number and compile-time options.

routine.name: postgis_wagyu_version
routine.comment: Returns the version number of the internal Wagyu library.

routine.name: st_3darea
routine.comment: args: geom1 - Computes area of 3D surface geometries. Will return 0 for solids.

routine.name: st_3dclosestpoint
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - Returns the 3D point on g1 that is closest to g2. This is the first point of the 3D shortest line.

routine.name: st_3dconvexhull
routine.comment: args: geom1 - Computes the 3D convex hull of a geometry.

routine.name: st_3ddifference
routine.comment: args: geom1, geom2 - Perform 3D difference

routine.name: st_3ddistance
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - Returns the 3D cartesian minimum distance (based on spatial ref) between two geometries in projected units.

routine.name: st_3dextent
routine.comment: args: geomfield - Aggregate function that returns the 3D bounding box of geometries.

routine.name: st_3dintersection
routine.comment: args: geom1, geom2 - Perform 3D intersection

routine.name: st_3dlength
routine.comment: args: a_3dlinestring - Returns the 3D length of a linear geometry.

routine.name: st_3dlineinterpolatepoint
routine.comment: args: a_linestring, a_fraction - Returns a point interpolated along a 3D line at a fractional location.

routine.name: st_3dlongestline
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - Returns the 3D longest line between two geometries

routine.name: st_3dmakebox
routine.comment: args: point3DLowLeftBottom, point3DUpRightTop - Creates a BOX3D defined by two 3D point geometries.

routine.name: st_3dmaxdistance
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - Returns the 3D cartesian maximum distance (based on spatial ref) between two geometries in projected units.

routine.name: st_3dperimeter
routine.comment: args: geomA - Returns the 3D perimeter of a polygonal geometry.

routine.name: st_3dshortestline
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - Returns the 3D shortest line between two geometries

routine.name: st_3dunion
routine.comment: args: g1field - Perform 3D union.

routine.name: st_addmeasure
routine.comment: args: geom_mline, measure_start, measure_end - Interpolates measures along a linear geometry.

routine.name: st_addpoint
routine.comment: args: linestring, point, position = -1 - Add a point to a LineString.

routine.name: st_affine
routine.comment: args: geomA, a, b, d, e, xoff, yoff - Apply a 3D affine transformation to a geometry.

routine.name: st_alphashape
routine.comment: args: geom, alpha, allow_holes = false - Computes an Alpha-shape enclosing a geometry

routine.name: st_angle
routine.comment: args: line1, line2 - Returns the angle between two vectors defined by 3 or 4 points, or 2 lines.

routine.name: st_approximatemedialaxis
routine.comment: args: geom - Compute the approximate medial axis of an areal geometry.

routine.name: st_azimuth
routine.comment: args: origin, target - Returns the north-based azimuth of a line between two points.

routine.name: st_bdmpolyfromtext
st_bdpolyfromtext
st_boundary
routine.comment: args: geomA - Returns the boundary of a geometry.

routine.name: st_boundingdiagonal
routine.comment: args: geom, fits=false - Returns the diagonal of a geometrys bounding box.

routine.name: st_buildarea
routine.comment: args: geom - Creates a polygonal geometry formed by the linework of a geometry.

routine.name: st_chaikinsmoothing
routine.comment: args: geom, nIterations = 1, preserveEndPoints = false - Returns a smoothed version of a geometry, using the Chaikin algorithm

routine.name: st_clipbybox2d
routine.comment: args: geom, box - Computes the portion of a geometry falling within a rectangle.

routine.name: st_closestpointofapproach
routine.comment: args: track1, track2 - Returns a measure at the closest point of approach of two trajectories.

routine.name: st_clusterdbscan
routine.comment: args: geom, eps, minpoints - Window function that returns a cluster id for each input geometry using the DBSCAN algorithm.

routine.name: st_clusterintersectingwin
routine.comment: args: geom - Window function that returns a cluster id for each input geometry, clustering input geometries into connected sets.

routine.name: st_clusterkmeans
routine.comment: args: geom, number_of_clusters, max_radius - Window function that returns a cluster id for each input geometry using the K-means algorithm.

routine.name: st_clusterwithinwin
routine.comment: args: geom, distance - Window function that returns a cluster id for each input geometry, clustering using separation distance.

routine.name: st_collect
routine.comment: args: g1field - Creates a GeometryCollection or Multi* geometry from a set of geometries.

routine.name: st_collectionextract
routine.comment: args: collection, type - Given a geometry collection, returns a multi-geometry containing only elements of a specified type.

routine.name: st_collectionhomogenize
routine.comment: args: collection - Returns the simplest representation of a geometry collection.

routine.name: st_concavehull
routine.comment: args: param_geom, param_pctconvex, param_allow_holes = false - Computes a possibly concave geometry that contains all input geometry vertices

routine.name: st_constraineddelaunaytriangles
routine.comment: args: g1 - Return a constrained Delaunay triangulation around the given input geometry.

routine.name: st_convexhull
routine.comment: args: geomA - Computes the convex hull of a geometry.

routine.name: st_coorddim
routine.comment: args: geomA - Return the coordinate dimension of a geometry.

routine.name: st_coverageinvalidedges
routine.comment: args: geom, tolerance = 0 - Window function that finds locations where polygons fail to form a valid coverage.

routine.name: st_coveragesimplify
routine.comment: args: geom, tolerance, simplifyBoundary = true - Window function that simplifies the edges of a polygonal coverage.

routine.name: st_cpawithin
routine.comment: args: track1, track2, dist - Tests if the closest point of approach of two trajectoriesis within the specified distance.

routine.name: st_curvetoline
routine.comment: args: curveGeom, tolerance, tolerance_type, flags - Converts a geometry containing curves to a linear geometry.

routine.name: st_delaunaytriangles
routine.comment: args: g1, tolerance = 0.0, flags = 0 - Returns the Delaunay triangulation of the vertices of a geometry.

routine.name: st_difference
routine.comment: args: geomA, geomB, gridSize = -1 - Computes a geometry representing the part of geometry A that does not intersect geometry B.

routine.name: st_dimension
routine.comment: args: g - Returns the topological dimension of a geometry.

routine.name: st_distancecpa
routine.comment: args: track1, track2 - Returns the distance between the closest point of approach of two trajectories.

routine.name: st_dump
routine.comment: args: g1 - Returns a set of geometry_dump rows for the components of a geometry.

routine.name: st_dumppoints
routine.comment: args: geom - Returns a set of geometry_dump rows for the coordinates in a geometry.

routine.name: st_dumprings
routine.comment: args: a_polygon - Returns a set of geometry_dump rows for the exterior and interior rings of a Polygon.

routine.name: st_dumpsegments
routine.comment: args: geom - Returns a set of geometry_dump rows for the segments in a geometry.

routine.name: st_endpoint
routine.comment: args: g - Returns the last point of a LineString or CircularLineString.

routine.name: st_envelope
routine.comment: args: g1 - Returns a geometry representing the bounding box of a geometry.

routine.name: st_estimatedextent
routine.comment: args: table_name, geocolumn_name - Returns the estimated extent of a spatial table.

routine.name: st_expand
routine.comment: args: box, dx, dy, dz=0 - Returns a bounding box expanded from another bounding box or a geometry.

routine.name: st_extent
routine.comment: args: geomfield - Aggregate function that returns the bounding box of geometries.

routine.name: st_exteriorring
routine.comment: args: a_polygon - Returns a LineString representing the exterior ring of a Polygon.

routine.name: st_extrude
routine.comment: args: geom, x, y, z - Extrude a surface to a related volume

routine.name: st_filterbym
routine.comment: args: geom, min, max = null, returnM = false - Removes vertices based on their M value

routine.name: st_findextent
st_flipcoordinates
routine.comment: args: geom - Returns a version of a geometry with X and Y axis flipped.

routine.name: st_force2d
routine.comment: args: geomA - Force the geometries into a "2-dimensional mode".

routine.name: st_force3d
routine.comment: args: geomA, Zvalue = 0.0 - Force the geometries into XYZ mode. This is an alias for ST_Force3DZ.

routine.name: st_force3dm
routine.comment: args: geomA, Mvalue = 0.0 - Force the geometries into XYM mode.

routine.name: st_force3dz
routine.comment: args: geomA, Zvalue = 0.0 - Force the geometries into XYZ mode.

routine.name: st_force4d
routine.comment: args: geomA, Zvalue = 0.0, Mvalue = 0.0 - Force the geometries into XYZM mode.

routine.name: st_forcecollection
routine.comment: args: geomA - Convert the geometry into a GEOMETRYCOLLECTION.

routine.name: st_forcecurve
routine.comment: args: g - Upcast a geometry into its curved type, if applicable.

routine.name: st_forcelhr
routine.comment: args: geom - Force LHR orientation

routine.name: st_forcepolygonccw
routine.comment: args: geom - Orients all exterior rings counter-clockwise and all interior rings clockwise.

routine.name: st_forcepolygoncw
routine.comment: args: geom - Orients all exterior rings clockwise and all interior rings counter-clockwise.

routine.name: st_forcerhr
routine.comment: args: g - Force the orientation of the vertices in a polygon to follow the Right-Hand-Rule.

routine.name: st_forcesfs
routine.comment: args: geomA, version - Force the geometries to use SFS 1.1 geometry types only.

routine.name: st_frechetdistance
routine.comment: args: g1, g2, densifyFrac = -1 - Returns the Frchet distance between two geometries.

routine.name: st_generatepoints
routine.comment: args: g, npoints, seed = 0 - Generates random points contained in a Polygon or MultiPolygon.

routine.name: st_geomcollfromtext
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1, $2)) = 'GEOMETRYCOLLECTION' THEN public.ST_GeomFromText($1,$2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_geomcollfromwkb
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2)) = 'GEOMETRYCOLLECTION' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_geometricmedian
routine.comment: args: geom, tolerance = NULL, max_iter = 10000, fail_if_not_converged = false - Returns the geometric median of a MultiPoint.

routine.name: st_geometryn
routine.comment: args: geomA, n - Return an element of a geometry collection.

routine.name: st_geometrytype
routine.comment: args: g1 - Returns the SQL-MM type of a geometry as text.

routine.name: st_hasarc
routine.comment: args: geomA - Tests if a geometry contains a circular arc

routine.name: st_hausdorffdistance
routine.comment: args: g1, g2, densifyFrac - Returns the Hausdorff distance between two geometries.

routine.name: st_hexagon
routine.comment: args: size, cell_i, cell_j, origin - Returns a single hexagon, using the provided edge size and cell coordinate within the hexagon grid space.

routine.name: st_hexagongrid
routine.comment: args: size, bounds - Returns a set of hexagons and cell indices that completely cover the bounds of the geometry argument.

routine.name: st_interiorringn
routine.comment: args: a_polygon, n - Returns the Nth interior ring (hole) of a Polygon.

routine.name: st_interpolatepoint
routine.comment: args: linear_geom_with_measure, point - Returns the interpolated measure of a geometry closest to a point.

routine.name: st_inversetransformpipeline
routine.comment: args: geom, pipeline, to_srid - Return a new geometry with coordinates transformed to a different spatial reference system using the inverse of a defined coordinate transformation pipeline.

routine.name: st_isclosed
routine.comment: args: g - Tests if a LineStringss start and end points are coincident. For a PolyhedralSurface tests if it is closed (volumetric).

routine.name: st_iscollection
routine.comment: args: g - Tests if a geometry is a geometry collection type.

routine.name: st_isempty
routine.comment: args: geomA - Tests if a geometry is empty.

routine.name: st_isplanar
routine.comment: args: geom - Check if a surface is or not planar

routine.name: st_ispolygonccw
routine.comment: args: geom - Tests if Polygons have exterior rings oriented counter-clockwise and interior rings oriented clockwise.

routine.name: st_ispolygoncw
routine.comment: args: geom - Tests if Polygons have exterior rings oriented clockwise and interior rings oriented counter-clockwise.

routine.name: st_isring
routine.comment: args: g - Tests if a LineString is closed and simple.

routine.name: st_issimple
routine.comment: args: geomA - Tests if a geometry has no points of self-intersection or self-tangency.

routine.name: st_issolid
routine.comment: args: geom1 - Test if the geometry is a solid. No validity check is performed.

routine.name: st_isvalid
routine.comment: args: g, flags - Tests if a geometry is well-formed in 2D.

routine.name: st_isvaliddetail
routine.comment: args: geom, flags - Returns a valid_detail row stating if a geometry is valid or if not a reason and a location.

routine.name: st_isvalidreason
routine.comment: args: geomA, flags - Returns text stating if a geometry is valid, or a reason for invalidity.

routine.name: st_isvalidtrajectory
routine.comment: args: line - Tests if the geometry is a valid trajectory.

routine.name: st_largestemptycircle
routine.comment: args: geom, tolerance=0.0, boundary=POINT EMPTY - Computes the largest circle not overlapping a geometry.

routine.name: st_length2d
routine.comment: args: a_2dlinestring - Returns the 2D length of a linear geometry. Alias for ST_Length

routine.name: st_lengthspheroid
routine.comment: args: a_geometry, a_spheroid - Returns the 2D or 3D length/perimeter of a lon/lat geometry on a spheroid.

routine.name: st_letters
routine.comment: args: letters, font - Returns the input letters rendered as geometry with a default start position at the origin and default text height of 100.
routine.definition:
DECLARE letterarray text[]; letter text; geom geometry; prevgeom geometry = NULL; adjustment float8 = 0.0; position float8 = 0.0; text_height float8 = 100.0; width float8; m_width float8; spacing float8; dist float8; wordarr geometry[]; wordgeom geometry; -- geometry has been run through replace(encode(st_astwkb(geom),'base64'), E'\n', '') font_default_height float8 = 1000.0; font_default json = '{ "!":"", "&":"", "\"":"BgACAQUmwguEAgAAkwSDAgAAlAQBBfACAIACAACTBP8BAACUBA==", "''":"BgABAQUmwguEAgAAkwSDAgAAlAQ=", "R":"BgABAj9msgsREvYDABQAFAESARQBEgESAxIDEgUSBRAFEAcQBw4JDgkOCQ4LDAsMDQwLCg0KDwoNCA8IDwgPBhEEEwYTAhMEFQIXABcAowIAEwEVARMDEwMTBRMFEQcTBxELEQsRDQ8PDREPEQ0VC8QB/QMSEfkCABQSiQGyA3EAALEDFBHnAgASEgCgCwnCAscFogEALhISLACqAhEsLRKhAQAApQM=", "d":"BgABAkryBgDLAXAREQ8NEQ0PDREJDwkRBw8FDwURAw8DDwERAw8BEQEPACMCHwQfCB0MGw4bEhcUFxgVGhEeDSANJAkmBSgDKgEuAIADABYCFAIUAhQCFAQUBBIGEgYSBhAIEAgQCBAKDgoODAwMDAwMDgoOCg4KEAgQCBIGEgYSBhQEFgQWBBYCGAIYAHwAAKQCERrmAgARFwCnCxcADOsCugJGMgDmA3sAKxERLQCfAwolHBUmBSQKBAA=", "e":"", "h":"BgABAUHYBJAGAAYBBgAGAQYDBgEEAwYDBAMEBQQDAgUEBQIFAAUCBQB1AAC5BhIT5wIAFhQAlAsRGOYCABEZAKMCeAAYABgBFgEWARQDFAMSBRIFEgUQBxAJDgcOCQ4LDgsMCwwNCg0KDQoNCA8GDwYPBhEEEQQRBBMEEQITAhUCEwAVAO0FFhPnAgAUEgD+BQ==", "g":"", "f":"BgABAUH8A6QJBwAHAAUABwEFAQcBBQEFAwUDBQMDAwMDAwUDAwMFAQUAwQHCAQAWEgDZAhUUwQEAAOMEFhftAgAWFADKCQoSChIKEAoQCg4KDgwOCgwMDAoKDAwMCgwIDAgMCAwIDAYOCAwEDgYMBA4GDAIOBA4CDgQOAg4CDgAOAg4ADgC2AQAcDgDRAhkQowEA", "i":"", "j":"", "k":"BgABARKoA/QFIAC0AYoD5gIAjwK5BJICwwTfAgDDAbIDFwAAnwMSEeUCABISAJILERLmAgAREQCvBQ==", "n":"", "m":"", "l":"BgABAQnAAwDrAgASFgDWCxEa6gIAERkA0wsUFw==", "y":"", "q":"", "p":"", "o":"", "r":"BgACAQRigAkQAA8AAAABShAAhAFXDAwODAwKDgoOCBAIDgYQBhAEEAQQBBAEEAISABACEAAQAA4BEAAQARADEAEQAxADEAUSBRIHFAcUCxQLFA0WDVJFsQHzAQsMDQwLCgkICwgLCAkGCQYJBAkGBwIJBAcCBwQHAAcCBwAFAgcABQAHAQUABQEFAQUBBQEDAQUBAwMDAQMDAwEAmwYSEeMCABISAO4IEAA=", "u":"BgABAV2KBwGPAVANCQsHDQcNBw0FCwUNBQ0FDQMPAw8DEQMTARMBFQEVABUAFQITABMEEwITBBMEEQQRBhEGDwYRCA8KDQgPCg0MDQwLDAsOCRALDgcQBxIHEgUUBRQFFAMWAxgBGAEYARoA7gUTEuYCABMPAPsFAAcCBwIFBAcCBQYDBgUGAwgDBgMIAQgBCAEIAQoBCAAIAAoACAIIAggCCAIGBAgEBgQGBgYGBAYCBgQIAggACAD6BRES5AIAEREA7wgPAA==", "s":"", "t":"BgABAUe8BLACWAAaEADRAhsOaQANAA0ADwINAA0CDQANAg0CDQINBA0CCwYNBA0GCwYNBgsIDQgLCAsKCwgJDAsKCQwJDAkOCQ4HEAcSBxIHEgUUAOAEawAVEQDWAhYTbAAAygIVFOYCABUXAMUCogEAFhQA1QIVEqEBAADzAwIFBAMEBQQDBAMEAwYDBgMGAwYBCAEGAQgBBgEIAAgA", "w":"BgABARz8BsAEINYCKNgBERLuAgARD+8B3QgSEc0CABQSW7YCV7UCFBHJAgASEpMC3AgREvACABERmAHxBDDaAVeYAxES7gIAEREo1QE81wIIAA==", "z":"BgABAQ6cA9AGuQIAFw8AzAIaC9QFAAAr9wKjBuACABYQAMsCGQyZBgCaA9AG" }'; BEGIN
IF font IS NULL THEN font := font_default; END IF;
-- For character spacing, use m as guide size geom := ST_GeomFromTWKB(decode(font->>'m', 'base64')); m_width := ST_XMax(geom) - ST_XMin(geom); spacing := m_width / 12;
letterarray := regexp_split_to_array(replace(letters, ' ', E'\t'), E''); FOREACH letter IN ARRAY letterarray LOOP geom := ST_GeomFromTWKB(decode(font->>(letter), 'base64')); -- Chars are not already zeroed out, so do it now geom := ST_Translate(geom, -1 * ST_XMin(geom), 0.0); -- unknown characters are treated as spaces IF geom IS NULL THEN -- spaces are a "quarter m" in width width := m_width / 3.5; ELSE width := (ST_XMax(geom) - ST_XMin(geom)); END IF; geom := ST_Translate(geom, position, 0.0); -- Tighten up spacing when characters have a large gap -- between them like Yo or To adjustment := 0.0; IF prevgeom IS NOT NULL AND geom IS NOT NULL THEN dist = ST_Distance(prevgeom, geom); IF dist > spacing THEN adjustment = spacing - dist; geom := ST_Translate(geom, adjustment, 0.0); END IF; END IF; prevgeom := geom; position := position + width + spacing + adjustment; wordarr := array_append(wordarr, geom); END LOOP; -- apply the start point and scaling options wordgeom := ST_CollectionExtract(ST_Collect(wordarr)); wordgeom := ST_Scale(wordgeom, text_height/font_default_height, text_height/font_default_height); return wordgeom; END;

routine.name: st_lineextend
routine.comment: args: line, distance_forward, distance_backward=0.0 - Returns a line with the last and first segments extended the specified distance(s).

routine.name: st_linefrommultipoint
routine.comment: args: aMultiPoint - Creates a LineString from a MultiPoint geometry.

routine.name: st_linefromtext
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1)) = 'LINESTRING' THEN public.ST_GeomFromText($1) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_linefromwkb
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2)) = 'LINESTRING' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_linemerge
routine.comment: args: amultilinestring, directed - Return the lines formed by sewing together a MultiLineString.

routine.name: st_linestringfromwkb
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2)) = 'LINESTRING' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_linetocurve
routine.comment: args: geomANoncircular - Converts a linear geometry to a curved geometry.

routine.name: st_locatealong
routine.comment: args: geom_with_measure, measure, offset = 0 - Returns the point(s) on a geometry that match a measure value.

routine.name: st_locatebetween
routine.comment: args: geom, measure_start, measure_end, offset = 0 - Returns the portions of a geometry that match a measure range.

routine.name: st_locatebetweenelevations
routine.comment: args: geom, elevation_start, elevation_end - Returns the portions of a geometry that lie in an elevation (Z) range.

routine.name: st_longestline
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - Returns the 2D longest line between two geometries.

routine.name: st_m
routine.comment: args: a_point - Returns the M coordinate of a Point.

routine.name: st_makebox2d
routine.comment: args: pointLowLeft, pointUpRight - Creates a BOX2D defined by two 2D point geometries.

routine.name: st_makeenvelope
routine.comment: args: xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax, srid=unknown - Creates a rectangular Polygon from minimum and maximum coordinates.

routine.name: st_makeline
routine.comment: args: geoms - Creates a LineString from Point, MultiPoint, or LineString geometries.

routine.name: st_makepoint
routine.comment: args: x, y, z, m - Creates a 2D, 3DZ or 4D Point.

routine.name: st_makepointm
routine.comment: args: x, y, m - Creates a Point from X, Y and M values.

routine.name: st_makepolygon
routine.comment: args: outerlinestring, interiorlinestrings - Creates a Polygon from a shell and optional list of holes.

routine.name: st_makesolid
routine.comment: args: geom1 - Cast the geometry into a solid. No check is performed. To obtain a valid solid, the input geometry must be a closed Polyhedral Surface or a closed TIN.

routine.name: st_makevalid
routine.comment: args: input, params - Attempts to make an invalid geometry valid without losing vertices.

routine.name: st_maxdistance
routine.comment: args: g1, g2 - Returns the 2D largest distance between two geometries in projected units.

routine.name: st_maximuminscribedcircle
routine.comment: args: geom - Computes the largest circle contained within a geometry.

routine.name: st_memsize
routine.comment: args: geomA - Returns the amount of memory space a geometry takes.

routine.name: st_memunion
routine.comment: args: geomfield - Aggregate function which unions geometries in a memory-efficent but slower way

routine.name: st_minimumboundingcircle
routine.comment: args: geomA, num_segs_per_qt_circ=48 - Returns the smallest circle polygon that contains a geometry.

routine.name: st_minimumboundingradius
routine.comment: args: geom - Returns the center point and radius of the smallest circle that contains a geometry.

routine.name: st_minimumclearance
routine.comment: args: g - Returns the minimum clearance of a geometry, a measure of a geometrys robustness.

routine.name: st_minimumclearanceline
routine.comment: args: g - Returns the two-point LineString spanning a geometrys minimum clearance.

routine.name: st_minkowskisum
routine.comment: args: geom1, geom2 - Performs Minkowski sum

routine.name: st_mlinefromtext
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1, $2)) = 'MULTILINESTRING' THEN public.ST_GeomFromText($1,$2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_mlinefromwkb
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2)) = 'MULTILINESTRING' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_mpointfromtext
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1, $2)) = 'MULTIPOINT' THEN ST_GeomFromText($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_mpointfromwkb
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2)) = 'MULTIPOINT' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_mpolyfromtext
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1, $2)) = 'MULTIPOLYGON' THEN public.ST_GeomFromText($1,$2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_mpolyfromwkb
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2)) = 'MULTIPOLYGON' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_multi
routine.comment: args: geom - Return the geometry as a MULTI* geometry.

routine.name: st_multilinefromwkb
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1)) = 'MULTILINESTRING' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_multipointfromwkb
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1,$2)) = 'MULTIPOINT' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_multipolyfromwkb
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2)) = 'MULTIPOLYGON' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_ndims
routine.comment: args: g1 - Returns the coordinate dimension of a geometry.

routine.name: st_node
routine.comment: args: geom - Nodes a collection of lines.

routine.name: st_normalize
routine.comment: args: geom - Return the geometry in its canonical form.

routine.name: st_npoints
routine.comment: args: g1 - Returns the number of points (vertices) in a geometry.

routine.name: st_nrings
routine.comment: args: geomA - Returns the number of rings in a polygonal geometry.

routine.name: st_numgeometries
routine.comment: args: geom - Returns the number of elements in a geometry collection.

routine.name: st_numinteriorring
routine.comment: args: a_polygon - Returns the number of interior rings (holes) of a Polygon. Aias for ST_NumInteriorRings

routine.name: st_numinteriorrings
routine.comment: args: a_polygon - Returns the number of interior rings (holes) of a Polygon.

routine.name: st_numpatches
routine.comment: args: g1 - Return the number of faces on a Polyhedral Surface. Will return null for non-polyhedral geometries.
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.ST_GeometryType($1) = 'ST_PolyhedralSurface' THEN public.ST_NumGeometries($1) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_numpoints
routine.comment: args: g1 - Returns the number of points in a LineString or CircularString.

routine.name: st_offsetcurve
routine.comment: args: line, signed_distance, style_parameters=' - Returns an offset line at a given distance and side from an input line.

routine.name: st_optimalalphashape
routine.comment: args: geom, allow_holes = false, nb_components = 1 - Computes an Alpha-shape enclosing a geometry using an "optimal" alpha value.

routine.name: st_orientation
routine.comment: args: geom - Determine surface orientation

routine.name: st_orientedenvelope
routine.comment: args: geom - Returns a minimum-area rectangle containing a geometry.

routine.name: st_patchn
routine.comment: args: geomA, n - Returns the Nth geometry (face) of a PolyhedralSurface.
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.ST_GeometryType($1) = 'ST_PolyhedralSurface' THEN public.ST_GeometryN($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_perimeter
routine.comment: args: geog, use_spheroid = true - Returns the length of the boundary of a polygonal geometry or geography.

routine.name: st_perimeter2d
routine.comment: args: geomA - Returns the 2D perimeter of a polygonal geometry. Alias for ST_Perimeter.

routine.name: st_point
routine.comment: args: x, y, srid=unknown - Creates a Point with X, Y and SRID values.

routine.name: st_pointfromtext
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1)) = 'POINT' THEN public.ST_GeomFromText($1) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_pointfromwkb
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2)) = 'POINT' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_pointm
routine.comment: args: x, y, m, srid=unknown - Creates a Point with X, Y, M and SRID values.

routine.name: st_pointn
routine.comment: args: a_linestring, n - Returns the Nth point in the first LineString or circular LineString in a geometry.

routine.name: st_pointonsurface
routine.comment: args: g1 - Computes a point guaranteed to lie in a polygon, or on a geometry.

routine.name: st_points
routine.comment: args: geom - Returns a MultiPoint containing the coordinates of a geometry.

routine.name: st_pointz
routine.comment: args: x, y, z, srid=unknown - Creates a Point with X, Y, Z and SRID values.

routine.name: st_pointzm
routine.comment: args: x, y, z, m, srid=unknown - Creates a Point with X, Y, Z, M and SRID values.

routine.name: st_polyfromtext
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1)) = 'POLYGON' THEN public.ST_GeomFromText($1) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_polyfromwkb
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2)) = 'POLYGON' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_polygon
routine.comment: args: lineString, srid - Creates a Polygon from a LineString with a specified SRID.

routine.name: st_polygonfromwkb
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1,$2)) = 'POLYGON' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_polygonize
routine.comment: args: geom_array - Computes a collection of polygons formed from the linework of a set of geometries.

routine.name: st_project
routine.comment: args: g1, g2, distance - Returns a point projected from a start point by a distance and bearing (azimuth).

routine.name: st_quantizecoordinates
routine.comment: args: g, prec_x, prec_y, prec_z, prec_m - Sets least significant bits of coordinates to zero

routine.name: st_reduceprecision
routine.comment: args: g, gridsize - Returns a valid geometry with points rounded to a grid tolerance.

routine.name: st_removepoint
routine.comment: args: linestring, offset - Remove a point from a linestring.

routine.name: st_removerepeatedpoints
routine.comment: args: geom, tolerance - Returns a version of a geometry with duplicate points removed.

routine.name: st_reverse
routine.comment: args: g1 - Return the geometry with vertex order reversed.

routine.name: st_rotate
routine.comment: args: geomA, rotRadians, pointOrigin - Rotates a geometry about an origin point.

routine.name: st_rotatex
routine.comment: args: geomA, rotRadians - Rotates a geometry about the X axis.

routine.name: st_rotatey
routine.comment: args: geomA, rotRadians - Rotates a geometry about the Y axis.

routine.name: st_rotatez
routine.comment: args: geomA, rotRadians - Rotates a geometry about the Z axis.

routine.name: st_scale
routine.comment: args: geom, factor, origin - Scales a geometry by given factors.

routine.name: st_scroll
routine.comment: args: linestring, point - Change start point of a closed LineString.

routine.name: st_segmentize
routine.comment: args: geog, max_segment_length - Returns a modified geometry/geography having no segment longer than a given distance.

routine.name: st_seteffectivearea
routine.comment: args: geomA, threshold = 0, set_area = 1 - Sets the effective area for each vertex, using the Visvalingam-Whyatt algorithm.

routine.name: st_setpoint
routine.comment: args: linestring, zerobasedposition, point - Replace point of a linestring with a given point.

routine.name: st_sharedpaths
routine.comment: args: lineal1, lineal2 - Returns a collection containing paths shared by the two input linestrings/multilinestrings.

routine.name: st_shiftlongitude
routine.comment: args: geom - Shifts the longitude coordinates of a geometry between -180..180 and 0..360.

routine.name: st_simplify
routine.comment: args: geomA, tolerance, preserveCollapsed - Returns a simplified version of a geometry, using the Douglas-Peucker algorithm.

routine.name: st_simplifypolygonhull
routine.comment: args: param_geom, vertex_fraction, is_outer = true - Computes a simplifed topology-preserving outer or inner hull of a polygonal geometry.

routine.name: st_simplifypreservetopology
routine.comment: args: geomA, tolerance - Returns a simplified and valid version of a geometry, using the Douglas-Peucker algorithm.

routine.name: st_simplifyvw
routine.comment: args: geomA, tolerance - Returns a simplified version of a geometry, using the Visvalingam-Whyatt algorithm

routine.name: st_snap
routine.comment: args: input, reference, tolerance - Snap segments and vertices of input geometry to vertices of a reference geometry.

routine.name: st_snaptogrid
routine.comment: args: geomA, pointOrigin, sizeX, sizeY, sizeZ, sizeM - Snap all points of the input geometry to a regular grid.

routine.name: st_split
routine.comment: args: input, blade - Returns a collection of geometries created by splitting a geometry by another geometry.

routine.name: st_square
routine.comment: args: size, cell_i, cell_j, origin - Returns a single square, using the provided edge size and cell coordinate within the square grid space.

routine.name: st_squaregrid
routine.comment: args: size, bounds - Returns a set of grid squares and cell indices that completely cover the bounds of the geometry argument.

routine.name: st_startpoint
routine.comment: args: geomA - Returns the first point of a LineString.

routine.name: st_straightskeleton
routine.comment: args: geom - Compute a straight skeleton from a geometry

routine.name: st_subdivide
routine.comment: args: geom, max_vertices=256, gridSize = -1 - Computes a rectilinear subdivision of a geometry.

routine.name: st_summary
routine.comment: args: g - Returns a text summary of the contents of a geometry.

routine.name: st_swapordinates
routine.comment: args: geom, ords - Returns a version of the given geometry with given ordinate values swapped.

routine.name: st_symdifference
routine.comment: args: geomA, geomB, gridSize = -1 - Computes a geometry representing the portions of geometries A and B that do not intersect.

routine.name: st_tesselate
routine.comment: args: geom - Perform surface Tesselation of a polygon or polyhedralsurface and returns as a TIN or collection of TINS

routine.name: st_tileenvelope
routine.comment: args: tileZoom, tileX, tileY, bounds=SRID=3857;LINESTRING(-20037508.342789 -20037508.342789,20037508.342789 20037508.342789), margin=0.0 - Creates a rectangular Polygon in Web Mercator (SRID:3857) using the XYZ tile system.

routine.name: st_transform
routine.comment: args: geom, from_proj, to_srid - Return a new geometry with coordinates transformed to a different spatial reference system.

routine.name: st_transformpipeline
routine.comment: args: g1, pipeline, to_srid - Return a new geometry with coordinates transformed to a different spatial reference system using a defined coordinate transformation pipeline.

routine.name: st_translate
routine.comment: args: g1, deltax, deltay, deltaz - Translates a geometry by given offsets.

routine.name: st_transscale
routine.comment: args: geomA, deltaX, deltaY, XFactor, YFactor - Translates and scales a geometry by given offsets and factors.

routine.name: st_triangulatepolygon
routine.comment: args: geom - Computes the constrained Delaunay triangulation of polygons

routine.name: st_unaryunion
routine.comment: args: geom, gridSize = -1 - Computes the union of the components of a single geometry.

routine.name: st_union
routine.comment: args: g1field, gridSize - Computes a geometry representing the point-set union of the input geometries.

routine.name: st_volume
routine.comment: args: geom1 - Computes the volume of a 3D solid. If applied to surface (even closed) geometries will return 0.

routine.name: st_voronoilines
routine.comment: args: geom, tolerance = 0.0, extend_to = NULL - Returns the boundaries of the Voronoi diagram of the vertices of a geometry.

routine.name: st_voronoipolygons
routine.comment: args: geom, tolerance = 0.0, extend_to = NULL - Returns the cells of the Voronoi diagram of the vertices of a geometry.

routine.name: st_wrapx
routine.comment: args: geom, wrap, move - Wrap a geometry around an X value.

routine.name: st_x
routine.comment: args: a_point - Returns the X coordinate of a Point.

routine.name: st_xmax
routine.comment: args: aGeomorBox2DorBox3D - Returns the X maxima of a 2D or 3D bounding box or a geometry.

routine.name: st_xmin
routine.comment: args: aGeomorBox2DorBox3D - Returns the X minima of a 2D or 3D bounding box or a geometry.

routine.name: st_y
routine.comment: args: a_point - Returns the Y coordinate of a Point.

routine.name: st_ymax
routine.comment: args: aGeomorBox2DorBox3D - Returns the Y maxima of a 2D or 3D bounding box or a geometry.

routine.name: st_ymin
routine.comment: args: aGeomorBox2DorBox3D - Returns the Y minima of a 2D or 3D bounding box or a geometry.

routine.name: st_z
routine.comment: args: a_point - Returns the Z coordinate of a Point.

routine.name: st_zmax
routine.comment: args: aGeomorBox2DorBox3D - Returns the Z maxima of a 2D or 3D bounding box or a geometry.

routine.name: st_zmflag
routine.comment: args: geomA - Returns a code indicating the ZM coordinate dimension of a geometry.

routine.name: st_zmin
routine.comment: args: aGeomorBox2DorBox3D - Returns the Z minima of a 2D or 3D bounding box or a geometry.

routine.name: unlockrows
routine.comment: args: auth_token - Removes all locks held by an authorization token.

routine.name: updategeometrysrid
routine.comment: args: catalog_name, schema_name, table_name, column_name, srid - Updates the SRID of all features in a geometry column, and the table metadata.
